column6: Contains Phenoxythenol near top of ingredient list. That is a chemical preservative
column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2019
column14: I liked the color. It’s nice. Warm undertones on a natural looking pink.  I got pomegranate. Goes on well over my beeswax chapstick.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2019
column14: I have worn Loreal Endless Mauve Amour for years before it was discontinued-Rhubarb is about as close to that color that I have found!!! Super moisturizing & feels great on my lips, not too sure it will be “long-lasting.” The first picture is right after I applied, the second picture is after blotting on a tissue (get some of the shine off).  Love it!!!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2018
column14: My fault for not reading the ingredients in this lipstick.  Thought with it claiming certified organic ingredients that it was a non toxic product.  However, one of the ingredients is phenoxyethanol and every site describing that ingredient list it as "toxic" "carcinogenic" and one site even states that it should not be used around the lips or where it might be ingested.  Now I have two tubes of this product that I have wasted my money on and will have to dispose of..

column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2020
column14: Lipsticks should be no more than $10 and I don't care how great it is.. this product stays on... llasted longer than Hemp Organics that I used on one side of my face after eating.  That was impressive.  I'll buy more if the price goes down to at least $15.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2017
column14: I'll start off by saying that I was hesitant to spend 22 bucks on a lipstick, even if it was a natural one, but some of the reviews helped me decide to get it, and boy am I glad I did. This lipstick is so creamy even on my super dry lips and it does last. I have tried other natural lipsticks but this one takes the crown. Ill get other colors!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2020
column14: I am really happy with my purchase of this lipstick. I got sweet pea and it's super hard to find a frosty pink lipstick and even harder to find it cruelty free and Leaping Bunny Certified, which is all kinds of wonderful. Well I'm thrilled with it all. I love love love this frosty pink lipstick. It's a lighter shade, which I don't wear dark colors well at all, my lips are thin and small so dark shades just do not look good, to me anyway. So I've always wore lighter shades, leaning towards the pinks in general. Hard to find and it being cruelty free is even harder, but I won't buy and will do without frosty lipstick if it's not cruelty free and now oh boy I don't have too. This fits the bill in every way possible, feels wonderful, looks wonderful and wears great. They're stuck with me. I even ordered and got the Jicama color which is light frosty tannish color. Oh golly I think its wonderful too!! They are stuck with me!! Love this friendly company.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2018
column14: I have searched for the right semi-frosted neutral color from other high-end cosmetics and none comes close to satisfying that search than the Jimaca lipstick I bought from Skin2Spirit. It's perfect for work, and then again, it'll be wonderful for summer. I hope they never stop making it!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2018
column14: Love the smell, consistency and of course the all natural ingredients!  I gave it a 4 stars only b/c the Sweet Pea was a lot more shimmery than appeared on this picture. I was hoping for more of a matte finish but I'll still happy with the product.
